newsitem.title: USA: May Department June same store sales up.
newsitem.headline: May Department June same store sales up.

text.p: May Department Stores Co said Thursday its same store sales for the five weeks ended July 5 rose 4.6 percent.
Total sales for June rose 10.4 percent to $1.03 billion from $931.9 million.
For the year-to-date period, same store sales gained 2.9 percent, while total sales rose 8.7 percent to $4.52 billion from $4.16 billion.

May said its results exclude the sales of stores that have been closed and not replaced. Year-to-date revenues, including sales of non-replaced closed stores and finance charge revenues, wre $4.66 billion in 1997, up from $4.33 billion in 1996.
Year-to-date, the retailer has opened four new department stores. An additional nine new department stores are planned for the remainder of the year.
May operates 366 department stores in 30 states and the District of Columbia.
